title: Enhance homepage colors, layout safety, animations, and add finance-style photo sections

requirements.text: Improve the Home page visual theme so it is not overly light: increase contrast, introduce a cohesive finance/army-green palette (backgrounds, cards, headings, buttons), and ensure consistent typography and spacing across sections.

quotes: front page is very light add proper colors

acceptanceCriteria: Home page sections have clearly differentiated background tones (e.g., alternating subtle tints) and readable text contrast on all cards/sections.
Primary/secondary CTA buttons have clear hover/focus states and remain readable on light and dark backgrounds.
No user-facing text is changed to non-English as part of this redesign (English only for new UI copy).

requirements.text: Fix layout collisions/overlaps on the Home page by auditing responsive breakpoints and spacing (especially hero overlays, section transitions, and card grids) so content never visually collides at common viewport sizes.

quotes: add proper colors and animations so it will not collide with each other

acceptanceCriteria: At widths 360px, 768px, 1024px, and 1440px, no text, buttons, or images overlap each other (including the hero CTA overlay and carousel).
All sections maintain adequate vertical spacing between headings, cards, and media; no clipped content occurs.
Sticky/mobile UI (if present) does not cover critical Home page content.

requirements.text: Enhance homepage animations to feel more like modern finance websites while remaining lightweight: add subtle section transitions, hover micro-interactions, and (where appropriate) animated accent elements; all animations must respect prefers-reduced-motion.

quotes: take example of other finance websites

acceptanceCriteria: Animations remain smooth and subtle (no large distracting motion) and are consistent across sections.
When the OS setting prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, auto-advancing and motion-heavy effects are disabled/reduced while content remains fully accessible.
Interactive elements (cards/buttons) show clear hover and focus feedback without layout shift.

requirements.text: Add additional Home page content sections beyond the current limited set, inspired by finance marketing sites, including at minimum: (1) a customer savings/profit examples section with multiple example cards and figures, and (2) one additional credibility-oriented section (e.g., testimonials slider, FAQs, or stats/metrics).

quotes: only three home contant add few more
add more data and features profits to custoners example of saving and all

acceptanceCriteria: Home page includes a dedicated section that shows multiple (3+) example profit/savings scenarios in a clear card layout.
Home page includes at least one additional section chosen from testimonials, FAQs, or stats/metrics, with consistent styling and spacing.
All new sections are responsive and do not create overlap/collision issues.

requirements.text: Add finance-website-style 'celebrity' photo content using AI-generated, non-identifiable celebrity-style/brand-ambassador imagery (do not use real person likenesses) and integrate these images into one or more Home page sections in a visually coherent way.

quotes: add celebrity photos if u can

acceptanceCriteria: New AI-generated photo-style images are added as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and rendered on the Home page.
Images are clearly non-identifiable (no real celebrity likeness) and match the site’s color theme.
Images load via existing public asset URL handling and display a graceful fallback on error (using the existing image component pattern).

requirements.text: Update the structured content source(s) used by the Home page so the new sections (profit/savings examples and additional credibility content) are content-driven (easy to edit) rather than hardcoded in multiple places.
acceptanceCriteria: New Home page sections pull their titles/body/items from the existing content module pattern (e.g., frontend/src/content/faujiFinanceContent.ts).
No duplicated content constants are introduced in page components when a centralized content module is available.
The Home page renders successfully with the expanded content set.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only components must be composed, not edited).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook/bootstrap files (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no additional backend services or databases.
nonGoals: Implementing real celebrity integrations, scraping, or using copyrighted celebrity photos.
Adding third-party auth providers beyond Internet Identity.
Building a complex admin CMS; only lightweight content-constant updates are in scope.

required: Photo-style portrait of a non-identifiable finance brand ambassador in a premium suit, army-green + cream color grading (celebrity-ambassador-1.dim_1200x1200.png)
Photo-style portrait of a non-identifiable finance brand ambassador, confident pose, studio lighting, army-green theme (celebrity-ambassador-2.dim_1200x1200.png)
Wide photo-style banner with 2–3 non-identifiable finance ambassadors, modern fintech aesthetic, army-green palette (celebrity-banner.dim_1920x800.png)
